intro: Johrenia strausii, commonly known as the Straus's johrenia, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions in southern Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae, which includes many grass-like plants adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces tiny, clustered flowers that are typically pale green or yellowish in color. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Johrenia strausii is considered a vulnerable species.
